name: XcodeBuildMCP_discover_projs
description: Scans a directory (defaults to workspace root) to find Xcode project (.xcodeproj) and workspace (.xcworkspace) files.

workspaceRoot.description: The absolute path of the workspace root to scan within.

scanPath.description: Optional: Path relative to workspace root to scan. Defaults to workspace root.

maxDepth.description: Optional: Maximum directory depth to scan. Defaults to 5.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_list_schems_ws
description: Lists available schemes in the workspace. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath. Example: list_schems_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_list_schems_proj
description: Lists available schemes in the project file. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath. Example: list_schems_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_list_sims
description: Lists available iOS simulators with their UUIDs.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_show_build_set_ws
description: Shows build settings from a workspace using xcodebuild. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath and scheme. Example: show_build_set_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_show_build_set_proj
description: Shows build settings from a project file using xcodebuild. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath and scheme. Example: show_build_set_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_clean_ws
description: Cleans build products for a specific workspace using xcodebuild. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath. Scheme/Configuration are optional. Example: clean_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

configuration.description: Optional: Build configuration to clean (Debug, Release, etc.)

derivedDataPath.description: Optional: Path where derived data might be located

name: XcodeBuildMCP_clean_proj
description: Cleans build products for a specific project file using xcodebuild. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath. Scheme/Configuration are optional. Example: clean_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

configuration.description: Optional: Build configuration to clean (Debug, Release, etc.)

derivedDataPath.description: Optional: Path where derived data might be located

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_build
description: Builds a Swift Package with swift build

packagePath.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

architectures.description: Architectures to build for (e.g. arm64, x86_64)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_test
description: Runs tests for a Swift Package with swift test

packagePath.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

testProduct.description: Optional specific test product to run

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_run
description: Runs an executable target from a Swift Package with swift run

packagePath.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

executableName.description: Name of executable to run (defaults to package name)

arguments.description: Arguments to pass to the executable

background.description: Run in background and return immediately (default: false)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_stop
description: Stops a running Swift Package executable started with swift_package_run

pid.description: Process ID (PID) of the running executable

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_list
description: Lists currently running Swift Package processes

name: XcodeBuildMCP_swift_package_clean
description: Cleans Swift Package build artifacts and derived data

packagePath.description: Path to the Swift package root (Required)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_mac_ws
description: Builds a macOS app using xcodebuild from a workspace.

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

arch.description: Architecture to build for (arm64 or x86_64). For macOS only.

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_mac_proj
description: Builds a macOS app using xcodebuild from a project file.

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

arch.description: Architecture to build for (arm64 or x86_64). For macOS only.

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_mac_ws
description: Builds and runs a macOS app from a workspace in one step.

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_mac_proj
description: Builds and runs a macOS app from a project file in one step.

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_sim_name_ws
description: Builds an iOS app from a workspace for a specific simulator by name. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, and simulatorName. Example: build_ios_sim_name_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_sim_name_proj
description: Builds an iOS app from a project file for a specific simulator by name. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, and simulatorName. Example: build_ios_sim_name_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_sim_id_ws
description: Builds an iOS app from a workspace for a specific simulator by UUID. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, and simulatorId. Example: build_ios_sim_id_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_sim_id_proj
description: Builds an iOS app from a project file for a specific simulator by UUID. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, and simulatorId. Example: build_ios_sim_id_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_ios_sim_name_ws
description: Builds and runs an iOS app from a workspace on a simulator specified by name. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, and simulatorName. Example: build_run_ios_sim_name_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_ios_sim_name_proj
description: Builds and runs an iOS app from a project file on a simulator specified by name. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, and simulatorName. Example: build_run_ios_sim_name_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_ios_sim_id_ws
description: Builds and runs an iOS app from a workspace on a simulator specified by UUID. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, and simulatorId. Example: build_run_ios_sim_id_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_run_ios_sim_id_proj
description: Builds and runs an iOS app from a project file on a simulator specified by UUID. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, and simulatorId. Example: build_run_ios_sim_id_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_dev_ws
description: Builds an iOS app from a workspace for a physical device. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath and scheme. Example: build_ios_dev_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcworkspace', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_build_ios_dev_proj
description: Builds an iOS app from a project file for a physical device. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath and scheme. Example: build_ios_dev_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/MyProject.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

derivedDataPath.description: Path where build products and other derived data will go

preferXcodebuild.description: If true, prefers xcodebuild over the experimental incremental build system, useful for when incremental build system fails.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_mac_app_path_ws
description: Gets the app bundle path for a macOS application using a workspace. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath and scheme. Example: get_mac_app_path_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

arch.description: Architecture to build for (arm64 or x86_64). For macOS only.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_mac_app_path_proj
description: Gets the app bundle path for a macOS application using a project file. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath and scheme. Example: get_mac_app_path_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

arch.description: Architecture to build for (arm64 or x86_64). For macOS only.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_ios_dev_app_path_ws
description: Gets the app bundle path for an iOS physical device application using a workspace. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath and scheme. Example: get_ios_dev_app_path_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_ios_dev_app_path_proj
description: Gets the app bundle path for an iOS physical device application using a project file. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath and scheme. Example: get_ios_dev_app_path_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme' })

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_sim_app_path_name_ws
description: Gets the app bundle path for a simulator by name using a workspace. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, platform, and simulatorName. Example: get_sim_app_path_name_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', platform: 'iOS Simulator', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_sim_app_path_name_proj
description: Gets the app bundle path for a simulator by name using a project file. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, platform, and simulatorName. Example: get_sim_app_path_name_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', platform: 'iOS Simulator', simulatorName: 'iPhone 16' })

simulatorName.description: Name of the simulator to use (e.g., 'iPhone 16') (Required)

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_sim_app_path_id_ws
description: Gets the app bundle path for a simulator by UUID using a workspace. IMPORTANT: Requires workspacePath, scheme, platform, and simulatorId. Example: get_sim_app_path_id_ws({ workspacePath: '/path/to/workspace', scheme: 'MyScheme', platform: 'iOS Simulator', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_sim_app_path_id_proj
description: Gets the app bundle path for a simulator by UUID using a project file. IMPORTANT: Requires projectPath, scheme, platform, and simulatorId. Example: get_sim_app_path_id_proj({ projectPath: '/path/to/project.xcodeproj', scheme: 'MyScheme', platform: 'iOS Simulator', simulatorId: 'SIMULATOR_UUID' })

simulatorId.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from listSimulators) (Required)

useLatestOS.description: Whether to use the latest OS version for the named simulator

name: XcodeBuildMCP_boot_sim
description: Boots an iOS simulator. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the simulatorUuid parameter. Example: boot_sim({ simulatorUuid: 'YOUR_UUID_HERE' })

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_open_sim
description: Opens the iOS Simulator app.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_set_sim_appearance
description: Sets the appearance mode (dark/light) of an iOS simulator.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

mode.description: The appearance mode to set (either "dark" or "light")

name: XcodeBuildMCP_set_simulator_location
description: Sets a custom GPS location for the simulator.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

latitude.description: The latitude for the custom location.

longitude.description: The longitude for the custom location.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_reset_simulator_location
description: Resets the simulator's location to default.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_set_network_condition
description: Simulates different network conditions (e.g., wifi, 3g, edge, high-latency, dsl, 100%loss, 3g-lossy, very-lossy) in the simulator.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

profile.description: The network profile to simulate. Must be one of: wifi, 3g, edge, high-latency, dsl, 100%loss, 3g-lossy, very-lossy.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_reset_network_condition
description: Resets network conditions to default in the simulator.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_install_app_sim
description: Installs an app in an iOS simulator. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide both the simulatorUuid and appPath parameters. Example: install_app_sim({ simulatorUuid: 'YOUR_UUID_HERE', appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' })

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

appPath.description: Path to the .app bundle to install (full path to the .app directory)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_launch_app_sim
description:
Launches an app in an iOS simulator. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide both the simulatorUuid and bundleId parameters.

Note: You must install the app in the simulator before launching. The typical workflow is: build → install → launch. Example: launch_app_sim({ simulatorUuid: 'YOUR_UUID_HERE', bundleId: 'com.example.MyApp' })

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

bundleId.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

name: XcodeBuildMCP_launch_app_logs_sim
description: Launches an app in an iOS simulator and captures its logs.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to use (obtained from list_simulators)

bundleId.description: Bundle identifier of the app to launch (e.g., 'com.example.MyApp')

args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_mac_bundle_id
description: Extracts the bundle identifier from a macOS app bundle (.app). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_mac_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_get_macos_bundle_id.

appPath.description: Path to the macOS .app bundle to extract bundle ID from (full path to the .app directory)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_get_ios_bundle_id
description: Extracts the bundle identifier from an iOS app bundle (.app). IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: get_ios_bundle_id({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_get_ios_bundle_id.

appPath.description: Path to the iOS .app bundle to extract bundle ID from (full path to the .app directory)

name: XcodeBuildMCP_launch_mac_app
description: Launches a macOS application. IMPORTANT: You MUST provide the appPath parameter. Example: launch_mac_app({ appPath: '/path/to/your/app.app' }) Note: In some environments, this tool may be prefixed as mcp0_launch_macos_app.

appPath.description: Path to the macOS .app bundle to launch (full path to the .app directory)

args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the app

name: XcodeBuildMCP_start_sim_log_cap
description: Starts capturing logs from a specified simulator. Returns a session ID. By default, captures only structured logs.

simulatorUuid.description: UUID of the simulator to capture logs from (obtained from list_simulators).

bundleId.description: Bundle identifier of the app to capture logs for.

captureConsole.description: Whether to capture console output (requires app relaunch).

name: XcodeBuildMCP_stop_sim_log_cap
description: Stops an active simulator log capture session and returns the captured logs.

logSessionId.description: The session ID returned by start_sim_log_cap.

name: XcodeBuildMCP_screenshot
description: Captures screenshot for visual verification. For UI coordinates, use describe_ui instead (don't determine coordinates from screenshots).

name: XcodeBuildMCP_scaffold_ios_project
description: Scaffold a new iOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper iOS configuration.

outputPath.description: Path where the project should be created

bundleIdentifier.description: Bundle identifier (e.g., com.example.myapp). If not provided, will use com.example.projectname

displayName.description: App display name (shown on home screen/dock). If not provided, will use projectName

marketingVersion.description: Marketing version (e.g., 1.0, 2.1.3). If not provided, will use 1.0

currentProjectVersion.description: Build number (e.g., 1, 42, 100). If not provided, will use 1

customizeNames.description: Whether to customize project names and identifiers. Default is true.

deploymentTarget.description: iOS deployment target (e.g., 18.4, 17.0). If not provided, will use 18.4

targetedDeviceFamily.description: Target device family. If not provided, will use iPhone+iPad

supportedOrientations.description: Supported orientations for iPhone. If not provided, will use all orientations

supportedOrientationsIpad.description: Supported orientations for iPad. If not provided, will use all orientations

name: XcodeBuildMCP_scaffold_macos_project
description: Scaffold a new macOS project from templates. Creates a modern Xcode project with workspace structure, SPM package for features, and proper macOS configuration.

outputPath.description: Path where the project should be created

bundleIdentifier.description: Bundle identifier (e.g., com.example.myapp). If not provided, will use com.example.projectname

displayName.description: App display name (shown on home screen/dock). If not provided, will use projectName

marketingVersion.description: Marketing version (e.g., 1.0, 2.1.3). If not provided, will use 1.0

currentProjectVersion.description: Build number (e.g., 1, 42, 100). If not provided, will use 1

customizeNames.description: Whether to customize project names and identifiers. Default is true.

deploymentTarget.description: macOS deployment target (e.g., 15.4, 14.0). If not provided, will use 15.4
